bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Multiple problems with the `semanage fcontext` command line and its documentation.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): Fedora 25
The problems are:
1. Running `semanage fcontext` without any flags or arguments spits out a short description of the expected command line. This description is completely broken, with various redundant ")"s.
2. The same broken specification appears in its man page (semanage-fcontext(8)).
3. According to this man page and the output of `semanage fcontext -h`, listing the local fcontext rules is supposed to be achieved using "-C, --locallist", neither of these work.
4. Following the broken command line in item #1 above, I finally found that the correct incantation is "semanage fcontext --list -C"

Thanks for reporting, fixed on upstream (soon to be backported to Fedora):
https://github.com/SELinuxProject/selinux/commit/86e568c27bd6e6d4428b9bca67c5de6a6bdcebb2
